results.snippet: Quiet Birthday; No Photos      ROBERT DE NIRO'S lawyer says this year's birthday celebration was nothing like last year's. ''Let's just say he spent it quietly,'' the lawyer, TOM HARVEY, said yesterday.
results.lead_paragraph: Quiet Birthday; No Photos ROBERT DE NIRO'S lawyer says this year's birthday celebration was nothing like last year's. ''Let's just say he spent it quietly,'' the lawyer, TOM HARVEY, said yesterday.

results.abstract: Interview with Mark Shuttleworth, who made half a billion dollars from Internet bubble and paid $20 million for ride in space, on his plan to tour remote, rural schools in his native South Africa with models of space capsule and rockets in bid to stir in students interest in math and science that underpinned his own success; he has set up philanthropic foundation to promote desire for schooling in South Africa; photo (M)

headline.main: The First 'Afronaut' Plans a Mission Back Home

results.snippet: PERHAPS the most obvious question to ask Mark Shuttleworth is this: after making half a billion dollars from the Internet bubble at the age of 26 and, two years later, buying a $20 million ride in space to become what Nelson Mandela called the first...
results.lead_paragraph: PERHAPS the most obvious question to ask Mark Shuttleworth is this: after making half a billion dollars from the Internet bubble at the age of 26 and, two years later, buying a $20 million ride in space to become what Nelson Mandela called the first ''Afronaut,'' what do you do for an encore? The response from this unassuming, South African-born entrepreneur is unexpected. Having achieved in a few years what most would not achieve in a lifetime, Mr. Shuttleworth, 28, said he did not want to try to re-create the intensity of his experiences in space or in business, despite having the personal wealth to try almost anything.
